story_headline: Biden, Israel Prime Minister Lapid sign strategic partnership declaration
story_copy: President Joe Biden and Israel Prime Minister Yair Lapid signed a strategic partnership declaration, reaffirming the strength of ties between both nations. The two leaders signed the Jerusalem US-Israel Strategic Partnership Joint Declaration Thursday after holding talks on Iran, Saudi Arabia and other issues in the Middle East.This morning I sat down with Israeli Prime Minister Lapid to sign a new strategic U.S.-Israel partnership based on a bedrock of shared values, our commitment to preserve and strengthen Israel's defense capabilities, and a true and enduring friendship. pic.twitter.com/Sk2T1GkzgZ‚Äî President Biden (@POTUS) July 14, 2022The declaration reaffirms America‚Äôs longstanding commitment to Israel‚Äôs security and both nation‚Äôs commitment to never allowing Iran to acquire a nuclear weapon. Additionally, Biden asserted his administration is ‚Äúdevoted‚Äù to protecting the Jewish state.‚ÄúWe talked about what was, from my perspective, for Israel to be totally integrated into the region,‚Äù stated the US President. ‚ÄúWe are guaranteed our administration and I think the vast majority of the American public, not just my administration, is completely devoted to Israel‚Äôs security.‚ÄùBiden also said the US will not wait forever in regards to potentially reviving the Obama-era nuclear deal with Iran.
image_caption: U.S. President Joe Biden, left, and Israel‚Äôs Prime Minister Yair Lapid, sign a security pledge at the Waldorf Astoria Hotel in Jerusalem, Thursday, July 14, 2022. (Atef Safadi/Pool via AP)

story_headline: Rep. Flores calls for stronger actions to secure southern border
story_copy: Rep. Flores calls for stronger actions to secure southern borderImmigrants walk towards border patrol after crossing the Rio Grande into the U.S. on June 21, 2021 in La Joya, Texas. (Photo by Brandon Bell/Getty Images)OAN NEWSROOMUPDATED 8:07 AM PT ‚Äì Thursday, July 14, 2022GOP congresswoman Mayra Flores (R-Texas) highlighted the need to secure the southern border. During a recent interview, she said the border needs to be secure to help people come to the US legally.Flores added, the crisis at the southern border has been largely ignored by many politicians in Washington. She contends inaction by lawmakers has helped fuel a cycle of violence and abuse, where women and children suffer unspeakable horrors at the hands of cartel-connected smugglers.‚ÄúUnfortunately, we have a border that is under control of criminal organizations in the South in Northern Mexico,‚Äù explained the congresswoman. ‚ÄúIt is a sad reality, but no one can cross the border into this country without having to pay thousands of dollars to criminal organizations. Women are abused, children are abused. This country is number on in child trafficking. This is something that I can‚Äôt understand how people can be so evil, but we must secure the border to protect the women, to protect the children.Flores also suggested President Biden is inviting migrants to make the dangerous trek to the southern border through his policies.‚ÄòIf we had better laws, laws that would help people not have to take these great risks, people would do it,‚Äù she noted. ‚ÄúBut this president with his policies, he is telling people to come. He is not saying it with words, but he is saying it with actions, with what he is doing. He is telling the people to practically come.‚Äùüö®BREAKING: One of the most massive single border groups witnessed crossing into Eagle Pass, TX.This is happening because @POTUS has signaled to the world that our borders are WIDE OPEN. https://t.co/hDglRRoFJV‚Äî House Homeland GOP (@HomelandGOP) July 13, 2022The Texas congressman also said under Biden, ‚Äúvery bad people‚Äù are making their way through the southern border while Border Patrol agents are busy tending to migrant women and children. Flores affirmed lawmakers need to take action to secure the border, but also said they need to create a better legal process to address the situation in which good people can come to the US without having to go through such dangerous conditions.
image_caption: Immigrants walk towards border patrol after crossing the Rio Grande into the U.S. on June 21, 2021 in La Joya, Texas. (Photo by Brandon Bell/Getty Images)

story_headline: FDA grants emergency authorization to Novavax COVID vaccine
story_copy: FDA grants emergency authorization to Novavax COVID vaccineFILE ‚Äì In this image provided by the Serum Institute of India, vials of freshly manufactured Novavax COVID-19 vaccines wait to be labeled in 2022, in Pune, India. The U.S. is getting another COVID-19 vaccine choice as the Food and Drug Administration on Wednesday, July 13, 2022, cleared Novavax shots for adults. (Serum Institute of India for Novavax via AP)OAN NEWSROOMUPDATED 7:37 AM PT ‚Äì Thursday, July 14, 2022The FDA authorized Novavax‚Äôs two-dose COVID-19 vaccine for adults over the age of 18. According to reports, officials approved the company‚Äôs vaccine clinical trial data, which suggested it was 90 percent effective at preventing a COVID infections.This came after multiple delays due to concerns about Novavax‚Äôs new manufacturing process. The CEO of the company, Stanley Erck, commented on the news during a recent press conference.‚ÄúSo the FDA has given us an emergency use authorization and that‚Äôs to authorize our vaccine to be used for a two-dose regimen in in primary vaccinations for all adults over 18 years old,‚Äù he expalined. ‚ÄúOur expectation with conversations with the FDA is that will then be expanded to include adolescents, will include booster doses, as they review the data that they already have in hand.‚ÄùThe Novavax COVID-19 vaccine has not been approved or licensed by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), but has been authorized for emergency use as a primary series to prevent COVID-19 in individuals 18+. [üßµ2 of 2]‚Äî Novavax (@Novavax) July 13, 2022Meanwhile, the CDC will have to sign off on the vaccine before it is made available. This comes after the FDA approved a second booster shot of either the Moderna or Pfizer COVID-19 vaccines for the elderly and immunocompromised people back in March.The Biden administration‚Äôs COVID-19 response team recently announced its new strategy in tackling the latest coronavirus subvariant. On Tuesday, the White House outlined its mitigation plan¬†for the BA.4 and BA.5 subvariants of the virus.Today, the Biden-Harris Administration announced its strategy to manage the BA.5 Omicron subvariant ‚Å†‚Äì ensuring Americans continue to have easy and convenient access to vaccines, treatments, tests, and other tools that protect against and treat COVID-19. https://t.co/Z0zhIpIcro‚Äî The White House (@WhiteHouse) July 12, 2022The outline includes changes and convenient access to vaccines, boosters and treatments while providing Americans with patient awareness and increasing protection to the immunocompromised. According to the White House, the subvariants are responsible for the majority of new cases sweeping the nation.
image_caption: FILE ‚Äì In this image provided by the Serum Institute of India, vials of freshly manufactured Novavax COVID-19 vaccines wait to be labeled in 2022, in Pune, India. The U.S. is getting another COVID-19 vaccine choice as the Food and Drug Administration on Wednesday, July 13, 2022, cleared Novavax shots for adults. (Serum Institute of India for Novavax via AP)

story_copy: Mexico dedicates $1.5B to border crisisMedical personnel check in with immigrants after they crossed the Rio Grande into the U.S. on June 21, 2021 in La Joya, Texas. (Photo by Brandon Bell/Getty Images)OAN NEWSROOMUPDATED 7:48 AM PT ‚Äì Thursday, July 14, 2022Mexico is dedicating $1.5 billion to assist the crisis at the border. While speaking to the press Wednesday, US Ambassador to Mexico Ken Salazar said Mexico is committed to putting in the ‚Äúinvestments needed‚Äù on Mexico‚Äôs side of the border.This follows a joint statement from President Joe Biden and his Mexican counterpart Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador, expressing their unified commitment to ‚Äúmanage the flow of migrants‚Äù flooding into the US.‚ÄúSo we‚Äôve been working on a joint plan, which is really part of the statement the President (Biden) made yesterday,‚Äù stated Salazar. ‚ÄúFor the first time in history, there is a plan that‚Äôs been put together in both United States side, with our investment and all of our resources, and on the Mexican side. What Mexico committed to do yesterday was to put in the investments that are needed on the Mexican side of the border and keep projects.‚ÄùMore than 2.8 million arrests have been made at the US-Mexico border since Biden took office in January of 2021. This has resulted in the exhaustion of border patrol resources and the deaths of migrants. Just last month, more than 50 migrants were found dead in a tractor trailer in San Antonio, Texas. Lopez Obrador confirmed most of those migrants were Mexican nationals and stressed the need for better border security is urgent.McAllen Border Patrol Station agents rescued 3 migrants from drowning in the Rio Grande on Tuesday. The individuals had jumped into the water in an attempt to swim back to Mexico.READ: https://t.co/syqEFjoJMU pic.twitter.com/r72JvEVDO5‚Äî CBP (@CBP) July 13, 2022The Mexican president proposed the Biden administration create new pathways for Mexican and Central American nationals to gain legal entry into the US. He explained that he hopes this will reduce ‚Äúirregular migration patterns while opening up new economic opportunities.‚Äù
image_caption: Medical personnel check in with immigrants after they crossed the Rio Grande into the U.S. on June 21, 2021 in La Joya, Texas. (Photo by Brandon Bell/Getty Images)

story_headline: US inflation surges to new 40-year record high
story_copy: US inflation surges to new 40-year record highMilk is displayed at a grocery store in Philadelphia, Tuesday, July 12, 2022. On Wednesday, July 13, 2022, the Labor Department will report on U.S. consumer prices for June. (AP Photo/Matt Rourke)OAN NEWSROOMUPDATED 1:26 PM PT ‚Äì Wednesday, July 13, 2022The data is in and it‚Äôs now confirmed that US inflation has reached a new 40-year record high. On Wednesday, the Labor Department released the Consumer Price Index (CPI) report for June, showing it increased 9.1 percent from a year ago. The CPI measures a range of prices from gas, groceries, cars and furniture to name a few.This number is above economists estimates of 8.8 percent. The report shows the largest contributors to inflation were shelter, gas, used vehicles and new cars. The Federal Reserve has already raised interest rates to combat inflation, but the latest inflation data is continuing to fuel concerns of a recession.Joe Biden‚Äôs failed economic agenda continues to punish Americans with 40-year high inflation, declining real wages, and a higher cost of living.‚Äî GOP (@GOP) July 10, 2022Just days ago, Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said the White House expects an ‚Äúelevated‚Äù inflation report for June, but claimed the numbers would be ‚Äúout of date.‚Äù This comes as some Republican lawmakers have accused Biden administration officials of misleading the American people about inflation.For instance, New Hampshire Governor Chris Sununu recently slammed US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen for doing just that. Sununu said low-income families and others on fixed incomes are going to suffer this coming winter with home heating costs expected to soar past record rates.In December, Biden claimed we were at ‚Äúthe peak‚Äù of inflation when prices spiked 7%. Now they are up 9.1% ‚Äì a new 40-year high.‚Äî Ronna McDaniel (@GOPChairwoman) July 13, 2022Meanwhile, Yellen previously shifted the responsibility of dealing with inflation away from the White House by claiming the Federal Reserve is responsible for dealing with the American economy. Prior to this, Yellen had suggested the Biden administration was running out of options to address its mishandling of the economy.Used cars for sale are parked roadside at an auto lot in Philadelphia, Tuesday, July 12, 2022. On Wednesday, July 13, 2022, the Labor Department will report on U.S. consumer prices for June. (AP Photo/Matt Rourke)President Biden downplayed the new data revealing inflation has reached a new 40-year high. In a statement Wednesday, Biden called the new inflation numbers ‚Äúout of date.‚Äù He added the notion that energy alone comprised nearly half of the monthly increase in inflation.Biden then claimed the data does not reflect the full impact of nearly 30 days of decreases in gas prices that have reduced the price at the pump by about 40 cents since mid-June. He also pointed out inflation is also high in Europe and other countries while suggesting many countries are battling COVID related challenges. Nonetheless, the Democrat insisted combating inflation is still his top priority.Meanwhile, Biden‚Äôs predecessor said 40-year high inflation is ‚Äúterrible for our country.‚Äù In a post on Truth Social Wednesday, Trump pointed out that fuel prices are up 60 percent, airfare is up 34 percent and eggs rose 33 percent. He then questioned how residents and businesses can survive amid the high prices.(Trump Statement)Trump asserted Democrats don‚Äôt know what they are doing and all they want to do is ‚Äúget trump.‚Äù He suggested those on the left are ‚Äúwilling to destroy the nation to do it. He concluded by urging citizens to not vote for ‚Äúradical left democrats,‚Äù but instead vote for ‚ÄòAmerica First‚Äô Republicans to ‚Äúsave America.‚Äù
image_caption: Milk is displayed at a grocery store in Philadelphia, Tuesday, July 12, 2022. On Wednesday, July 13, 2022, the Labor Department will report on U.S. consumer prices for June. (AP Photo/Matt Rourke)
more_news: ¬†Second Amendment Activist ‚ÄòOptimistic‚Äô In Reversing Gun Ban On D.C. MetroTOPICS:carsChris SununuConsumer Price IndexCPIECONOMYFederal ReservegasgroceriesinflationJanet YellenJoe BidenKarine Jean-PierrenewsOANOANNpoliticsspendingUS inflationUsed Cars SHARETWEETPINSHARE

story_headline: Senate GOP addresses concerns over Democrat attempt to revive Build Back Better
story_copy: Senate GOP addresses concerns over Democrat attempt to revive Build Back BetterFILE ‚Äì Sen. John Thune, R-S.D., speaks during a news conference on Capitol Hill in Washington, Dec. 7, 2021. (AP Photo/Carolyn Kaster File)OAN NEWSROOMUPDATED 10:22 AM PT ‚Äì Wednesday, July 13, 2022Senate Republicans are addressing concerns over a potential attempt by Democrats to revive their Build Back Better agenda. While speaking to the press Tuesday, GOP leadership addressed the matter while asserting their colleagues on the left are attempting to solve the economic crisis by spending more money.‚ÄúWe‚Äôve got rampant, runaway inflation,‚Äù stated Senate Minority Whip John Thune (R-S.D.). ‚ÄúThe American people are paying the price and what is the Democrat prescription? To double down, to spend more and to tax more.‚ÄùThe alleged new spending package could supposedly cut the initial cost by $1 trillion and aims to focus on health care costs and energy. However, this would require raising taxes, which would primarily hit business owners and corporations.‚ÄúNow they want to pour fuel on the flames by making it more likely that we go into a recession by raising taxes on all of these businesses,‚Äù explained Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-Ky.). ‚ÄúThe vast majority of businesses in America, which will only cause them to reduce the number of employees.‚ÄùSen. Joe Manchin (D-W.Va.), who was said by Democrats to have killed the bill last year, has reportedly been in talks with Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) recently. Democrats are looking at reducing the cost of prescription drugs within the revised package, which is a priority Manchin supports. However, Sen. Thune said Democrats real ‚Äúprescription‚Äù won‚Äôt benefit the American people.‚ÄúWe‚Äôre talking about higher taxes on the American people, higher taxes on businesses, higher prices and lower wages,‚Äù stressed the South Dakota Republican. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the Democrat prescription.‚ÄùAccording to reports, Democrats hope to pass the revised bill before September by using the budget reconciliation process. However, Republicans are worried there could be long lasting effects if a spending package like this is passed.‚ÄúThe American people have had enough,‚Äù Thune stated. ‚ÄúAnd I hope there are a couple of wise Democrats who will sink this really bad idea and make sure that we don‚Äôt go down a path that leads to even more economic tumult the American people are already feeling.‚ÄùLIVE: The Senate Republican leadership team speaks to the press. Join us.   https://t.co/kYjfP3zD2i‚Äî Senate Republicans (@SenateGOP) July 12, 2022
image_caption: FILE ‚Äì Sen. John Thune, R-S.D., speaks during a news conference on Capitol Hill in Washington, Dec. 7, 2021. (AP Photo/Carolyn Kaster File)

story_headline: Syrians blaming Biden for ongoing Mideast tensions
story_copy: Syrians blaming Biden for ongoing Mideast tensionsPresident Joe Biden wipes his eye as he speaks at the North America‚Äôs Building Trades Unions (NABTU) Legislative Conference at the Washington Hilton in Washington, Wednesday, April 6, 2022. (AP Photo/Carolyn Kaster)OAN NEWSROOMUPDATED 1:11 PM PT ‚Äì Wednesday, July 13, 2022Residents of Syria are criticizing Joe Biden amid his ongoing tour of the Middle East. According to Chinese media Wednesday, Syrian citizens are dissatisfied with his policies toward the region.In the CCTV survey, the majority of Syrians said Biden is responsible for ongoing regional tensions between Middle Eastern countries and he‚Äôs not interested in peace in the region.Biden arrived in Israel earlier in the day and reportedly plans to rally regional powers against Iran, Russia and China. However, the Syrians who participated in the survey said Biden‚Äôs policies are bad for the economy and regional security.‚ÄúBiden is trying to destabilize the region and carry out more plundering, which sparked inflation and fuel shortages,‚Äù stated Nader Hassoud, a resident of al-Hasakah. ‚ÄúWe lived well before the U.S. intervention, but now everything has been ruined.‚ÄùThe CCTV survey also found Syrians blame Biden for ongoing fighting in their country as Turkish-backed militants and Kurdish forces continue to clash in Syria‚Äôs northern regions.Biden: "With the last administration, we sorta walked away from the Middle East."FACT: President Trump's historic Abraham Accords continues to bring unprecedented peace and security to the Middle East. pic.twitter.com/wEYKjwSMjD‚Äî RNC Research (@RNCResearch) July 13, 2022Trump-era Secretary of State Mike Pomope too to Twitter to comment on the matter. He noted, ‚ÄúPresident Biden says he has created a more stable Middle East than we had in the Trump Administration. FALSE. The terrorists and Mullahs in Iran are the only ones who have benefited from Biden‚Äôs policies.
image_caption: President Joe Biden wipes his eye as he speaks at the North America‚Äôs Building Trades Unions (NABTU) Legislative Conference at the Washington Hilton in Washington, Wednesday, April 6, 2022. (AP Photo/Carolyn Kaster)

story_headline: Mexico‚Äôs president slams Biden for gas, border policies
story_copy: Mexico‚Äôs president slams Biden for gas, border policiesPresident Joe Biden listens as Mexican President Andr√©s Manuel L√≥pez Obrador speaks in the Oval Office of the White House in Washington, Tuesday, July 12, 2022. (AP Photo/Susan Walsh)OAN NEWSROOMUPDATED 6:45 AM PT ‚Äì Wednesday, July 13, 2022According to Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador, a number of Biden administration policies are getting out of hand. On Tuesday, both President Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris welcomed the Mexican leader to the White House. This meeting came after Lopez Obrador snubbed Biden last month when he refused to attend the Summit of the Americas, which was held in Los Angeles.During Tuesday‚Äôs meetings, the Mexican president lamented US gas prices are too high and his country has been saving oil to export to the US since the energy crisis started. This comes as the Biden administration has begged authoritarian governments in Saudi Arabia and Venezuela for oil instead of America‚Äôs allies. Meanwhile, Lopez Obrador stressed he‚Äôs saving Americans in border towns some money by letting them cross the border to buy cheaper gas.‚ÄúWhile prices of gasoline goes down in the United States, I hope that Congress approves your proposal of (lowering gas prices),‚Äù he stated. ‚ÄúIn the meantime, while we‚Äôre waiting for gasoline prices to go down, we are allowing Americans who live near our border to fill up their vehicles (with gasoline) on the Mexican side at lower prices.‚ÄùAdditionally, the Mexican president slammed the state of the US-Mexico border. He said the Biden administration needs to take steps to transform the border and move away from the status quo. Lopez Obrador proposed the Biden administration to create new pathways for Mexican and Central American nationals to gain legal entry into the US. He explained that he hopes this will reduce ‚Äúirregular migration patterns while opening up new economic opportunities.‚ÄùLast week, there were over 13,000 illegal crossings in the Del Rio sector and 8,400 in the Rio Grande Valley.Our border is porous, and thousands are flooding across. Yet Biden still wants to end the Remain in Mexico Policy and Title 42.We need a competent border policy.‚Äî Chuck Fleischmann (@RepChuck) July 12, 2022¬†The Biden administration has seen record levels of illegal immigration, resulting in the exhaustion of border patrol resources and the deaths of migrants. Just last month, more than 50 migrants were found dead in a tractor trailer in San Antonio, Texas. Lopez Obrador confirmed most of those migrants were Mexican nationals and stressed the need for better border security is urgent.‚ÄúRegularize now and give certainty to migrants who, since many years, work in an honest manner and contribute to the development of this great nation,‚Äù he stressed.The socialist president also praised Mexican citizens, touting their work in America bolsters the economies of both the US and Mexico.‚ÄúI just want to tell you that I love you very much, that love is repaid with love,‚Äù stated Lopez Obrador. ‚ÄúThat tomorrow at the White House we are going to talk about the rights of migrants and that we love you very much for all that you do, because you work here and you send money to your families. And thanks to that, our economy is getting back on its feet.‚ÄùIn the meantime, the two presidents agreed on a $1.5 billion package to improve ‚Äúsmart technologies‚Äù at America‚Äôs southern border. Biden also claimed he has launched a multi-lateral operation to take down human and drug smugglers that he claims has already led to the arrests of more than 3,000 smugglers. Lopez Obrador highlighted the importance of cooperation between the US and Mexico.
image_caption: President Joe Biden listens as Mexican President Andr√©s Manuel L√≥pez Obrador speaks in the Oval Office of the White House in Washington, Tuesday, July 12, 2022. (AP Photo/Susan Walsh)

story_headline: Rep. Johnson slams Dems for saying Canada ‚Äòmost free‚Äô country
story_copy: Rep. Johnson slams Dems for saying Canada ‚Äòmost free‚Äô countryWASHINGTON, DC ‚Äì JULY 28: Rep. Mike Johnson (R-LA) questions Attorney General William Barr who appears before the House Oversight Committee on July 28, 2020 on Capitol Hill in Washington D.C. (Photo by Matt McClain-Pool/Getty Images)OAN NEWSROOMUPDATED 3:40 PM PT ‚Äì Thursday, July 14, 2022Congressman Mike Johnson (R-La.) offered a fiery rebuttal to House Judiciary Democrats after they claimed that Canada is the most free country in the world. During a house hearing on Thursday, Johnson said that‚Äôs simply not true.‚ÄúMr. Cohen is wrong,‚Äù said Johnson. ‚ÄúCanada is not the most free country in the world young people. America is the greatest nation in the world. We are the most free, most successful, most powerful nation because finally now we‚Äôve tried to live up to the ideals articulated in the Declaration of Independence.‚ÄùDemocrats on the Judiciary Committee just said CANADA is the most free country in the world.@RepMikeJohnson just called them out:‚ÄúAMERICA is the greatest nation in the world. The most FREE, the most powerful, the most successful.‚Äù pic.twitter.com/JJMFBivYbi‚Äî House Judiciary GOP (@JudiciaryGOP) July 14, 2022Republicans have notably been critical of the Canadian government of Justin Trudeau over its COVID lockdowns and numerous scandals, including Trudeau wearing blackface. Johnson stressed that America must defend the sanctity of life and protect its Constitution.‚ÄúWe just celebrated our 246 birthday on the Fourth and we‚Äôre still an experiment in self governance,‚Äù he voiced. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre an experiment on the world stage. We have the greatest Constitution ever written, it‚Äôs endured for this long but it won‚Äôt endure if we abandon its principles.‚ÄùAmerica is the greatest nation the world has ever known, but we are always striving to become a more perfect union.Affirming the sanctity of every human life will help us get there. pic.twitter.com/rZRBqrrptO‚Äî Rep. Mike Johnson (@RepMikeJohnson) July 14, 2022GOP lawmakers said Democrats must stand up for America instead of praising foreign countries with questionable leadership.
image_caption: WASHINGTON, DC ‚Äì JULY 28: Rep. Mike Johnson (R-LA) questions Attorney General William Barr who appears before the House Oversight Committee on July 28, 2020 on Capitol Hill in Washington D.C. (Photo by Matt McClain-Pool/Getty Images)

story_headline: Senate committee argues over state abortion laws
story_copy: Senate committee argues over state abortion lawsFrom left, Illinois Lt. Gov. Juliana Stratton, Senior Counsel and Director of the Center for Life for the Alliance Defending Freedom Denise Harle, UC Berkeley School of Law Professor Khiara Bridges, Alternatives Pregnancy Center Executive Director Heidi Matzke, and Planned Parenthood of the St. Louis Region and Southwest Missouri Chief Medical Officer Dr. Colleen McNicholas are sworn in to testify during a Senate Judiciary Committee Hearing to examine a post-Roe America, focusing on the legal consequences of the Dobbs decision, on Capitol Hill in Washington, Tuesday, July 12, 2022. (AP Photo/Andrew Harnik)OAN NEWSROOMUPDATED 1:00 PM PT ‚Äì Thursday, July 14, 2022During a hearing on Tuesday, senators from both sides of the aisle heard testimony from healthcare providers about the implications of the Supreme Court‚Äôs decision to allow states to implement their own abortion laws. Dr. Kristyn Brandi of Physicians for Reproductive Health told senators that state abortion bans were affecting how physicians treat patients, including withholding critical treatment.‚ÄúIt‚Äôs incredibly hard to think about being in that position where I can‚Äôt intervene because I have to call my lawyer first to make sure that it‚Äôs okay,‚Äù Brandi vocalized. ‚ÄúOr that I‚Äôm going to wait, wait and wait until somebody gets sicker because I don‚Äôt know what that law means. We‚Äôre seeing that across the country. I‚Äôm hearing stories from all over from physicians that are withholding lifesaving care because they don‚Äôt want to go to jail. That‚Äôs really not how health care should work.‚ÄùThe end of Roe changed everything. I've met women who have never voted for a Democrat before but are planning to now. We have to fight for every Senate seat in every state ‚Äì including here in Idaho ‚Äì to restore abortion rights. #idpol #CodifyRoe‚Äî David Roth ‚Äì Democratic Nominee to U.S. Senate (@rothforIdaho) July 13, 2022Sen. Patty Murray (D-Wash.) described the high court‚Äôs ruling as ‚Äúbarbaric.‚Äù‚ÄúAbout one in 50 pregnancies in our country are ectopic,‚Äù Murray voiced. ‚ÄúThat means they‚Äôre not viable and without medical action they are deadly. In Republican‚Äôs post-Roe world, health care providers aren‚Äôt sure when or even if they will be able to treat ectopic patients without being sent to prison. Some have already been instructed to observe patients until they have unstable vital signs before acting. Basically, sit on your hands until women are at dire risk before you can do what is medically necessary. That is absolutely barbaric.‚ÄùSenate GOP just BLOCKED my bill w/ @SenCortezMasto to protect the right to travel‚Äîincluding to get abortion care. This move shows that they stand w/ extreme politicians trying to hold women captive in their own states rather than defending the right to travel within our country. pic.twitter.com/6ZxWlkbz27‚Äî Senator Patty Murray (@PattyMurray) July 14, 2022Sen. Roger Marshall (R-Kansas) pushed back against her statement. He accused Democrats of using scare tactics and lying to American citizens about state‚Äôs who have laws banning abortion.‚ÄúMyth three, overturning Roe means health care professionals in hospitals cannot treat women with miscarriages, ectopic pregnancies or when the mom‚Äôs life is endangered,‚Äù Marshall said. ‚ÄúThese are all scare tactics preying on the emotions of people. Listen, every state abortion law triggered by overturning Roe includes an exception to save the life of the mother. Treating miscarriages and ectopic pregnancies are not the same as performing abortions. In fact, no abortion law in any state in America prevents treatment for women with ectopic pregnancies and or other life-threatening conditions.‚ÄùMeanwhile, Sen. Lisa Murkowski (R-Alaska) played the middle man by saying Congress would have to look at the issue further down the line.‚ÄúI think we‚Äôve got to look at this again,‚Äù Murkowski stated. Again down the road. The balance of power in Congress moves back and forth. Without the filibuster do we really think, do we really believe that a different majority would not seek a nationwide ban on abortion and find a way to succeed in enacting it? The filibuster is really one of the few mechanisms that protects the rights of the minority. I raise this because I think we need to be looking long term at this.‚ÄùIn the meantime, states remain split on their reaction to Roe‚Äôs end while the White House is expressing interest in declaring a health emergency to protect access to the procedure.
image_caption: From left, Illinois Lt. Gov. Juliana Stratton, Senior Counsel and Director of the Center for Life for the Alliance Defending Freedom Denise Harle, UC Berkeley School of Law Professor Khiara Bridges, Alternatives Pregnancy Center Executive Director Heidi Matzke, and Planned Parenthood of the St. Louis Region and Southwest Missouri Chief Medical Officer Dr. Colleen McNicholas are sworn in to testify during a Senate Judiciary Committee Hearing to examine a post-Roe America, focusing on the legal consequences of the Dobbs decision, on Capitol Hill in Washington, Tuesday, July 12, 2022. (AP Photo/Andrew Harnik)

story_headline: Trump: Fmr wife Ivana passed away at age 73
story_copy: Trump: Fmr wife Ivana passed away at age 73FILE ‚Äì Ivana Trump arrives for the amfAR Cinema Against AIDS benefit at the Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc, in Cap d‚ÄôAntibes, southern France, Thursday, May 20, 2010. (AP Photo/Joel Ryan, File)OAN NEWSROOMUPDATED 1:50 PM PT ‚Äì Thursday, July 14, 2022President Trump announced the death of his ex-wife Ivana. Ivana Trump is the mother of his three oldest children. He shared the news on Truth Social Thursday, saying he is saddened to tell the many who loved her that she passed away at her home in New York City.Trump went on to say she was a wonderful, beautiful and amazing woman who led a great and inspirational life. He spoke about how her pride and joy were her children. Ivana and Trump were married for 15 years. She mothered their son Don Jr., along with Ivanka and Eric.Rest In Peace to Ivana Trump.Praying for the Trump family. ‚ù§Ô∏è pic.twitter.com/lbx79qbNdA‚Äî Camryn Kinsey (@camrynbaylee) July 14, 2022In a statement, the Trump children remembered their mother as ‚Äúan incredible woman, a force in business, a world-class athlete, a radiant beauty, and caring mother and friend.‚Äù‚ÄúIvana Trump was a survivor,‚Äù they wrote. ‚ÄúShe fled from communism and embraced this country. She taught her children about grit, toughness, compassion and determination. She will be dearly missed by her mother, her three children and ten grandchildren.‚ÄùVery sad to hear Ivana Trump has died. She was a fabulously entertaining lady & great interviewee who remained fiercely loyal to her ex-husband Donald. My condolences to ‚Å¶@IvankaTrump‚Å© ‚Å¶@DonaldJTrumpJr‚Å© ‚Å¶@EricTrump‚Å© on the loss of their magnificent mother. pic.twitter.com/jzp4gNK0t9‚Äî Piers Morgan (@piersmorgan) July 14, 2022Their marriage came to an end in 1992 after reports linked Donald Trump to model and actress Marla Maples, who would become Trump‚Äôs second wife. The messy divorce dominated the front pages of the city‚Äôs papers, but the pair remained close after the split.The New York City police are investigating whether Ms. Trump fell down the stairs at her home on Manhattan‚Äôs Upper East Side, just off Fifth Avenue near Central Park, according to two law enforcement officials with knowledge of the matter. One of the officials said there was no sign of forced entry at the home and the death appeared to be accidental.She was 73-years-old.
image_caption: FILE ‚Äì Ivana Trump arrives for the amfAR Cinema Against AIDS benefit at the Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc, in Cap d‚ÄôAntibes, southern France, Thursday, May 20, 2010. (AP Photo/Joel Ryan, File)

story_headline: Trump returning to D.C. for first time since leaving WH
story_copy: Trump returning to D.C. for first time since leaving WHFILE ‚Äì President Donald Trump arrives at the White House in Washington, on Dec. 31, 2020. (AP Photo/Evan Vucci, File)OAN NEWSROOMUPDATED 5:30 PM PT ‚Äì Thursday, July 14, 2022Former President Trump will return to D.C. for the first time since leaving office. Trump is set to headline the America First agenda summit on July 26, but the research institute has yet to release a specific location. The policy summit is invitation only and open to the press. The general public will be able to watch speakers via live stream.¬†Trump will deliver a keynote address at 3 p.m. eastern on day two.Welcome back to Washington!üá∫üá∏ pic.twitter.com/0YBv2gKwsW‚Äî America First Policy Institute (@A1Policy) July 14, 2022A New York Times-Siena College poll released this week found 49 percent of Republican voters said they would back Trump in a GOP presidential primary. The poll showed that he remains popular, but that his hold on the party may not be as strong as it once was.Shaping up to be an informative event.  Great to be part of the AFPI Team. Thanks to all that have volunteered to speak. pic.twitter.com/Bfouyk0VdR‚Äî Keith Kellogg (@generalkellogg) July 14, 2022Guest speakers and attendees include former senior Trump administration officials Kellyanne Conway and Chad Wolf. Additionally, current members of Congress Kevin McCarthy (R-Calif.), Ted Cruz (R-Texas), Steve Scalise (R-La.), Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) and many more.Trump has delivered speeches and held rallies around the country for Republicans running for office over the past year and a half since he left the White House. He departed in January 2021.

story_headline: Sen. Cruz: Biden‚Äôs ‚Äòtacogate‚Äô erodes Dems‚Äô Latino support
story_copy: Sen. Cruz: Biden‚Äôs ‚Äòtacogate‚Äô erodes Dems‚Äô Latino supportSen. Ted Cruz, R-Texas, speaks during a news conference with Republican lawmakers about Ukraine, on Capitol Hill, Wednesday, March 2, 2022, in Washington. (AP Photo/Evan Vucci)OAN NEWSROOMUPDATED 12:00 PM PT ‚Äì Thursday, July 14, 2022Sen. Ted Cruz (R-Texas) slammed the Biden administration over its latest scandal known as ‚Äútaco-gate.‚Äù In a statement Wednesday, the Texas lawmaker ridiculed Democrat officials for pushing the woke term ‚ÄúLatinx‚Äù on the Latino community.CRUZ: ‚ÄúThe Biden White House has time to write speeches at something called a 'Latinx conference.' I don't know what that is‚Ä¶Some White House operative sat down and typed into the teleprompter. ‚ÄòThis is a good idea to call Hispanics a bunch of tacos‚Äô.‚Äùpic.twitter.com/X9Ud7JgMOe‚Äî Benny Johnson (@bennyjohnson) July 13, 2022‚ÄúWell Marco and I appreciate being called tacos,‚Äù Cruz said sarcastically. ‚ÄúRemember about that speech? That wasn‚Äôt a gaffe. That wasn‚Äôt Joe Biden going off script. Some White House operative sat down and typed into the teleprompter, this is a good idea to call Hispanics a bunch of tacos.‚ÄùThe Republican also said First Lady Jill Biden comparing Latinos to tacos was not a good idea. She has since apologized for her recent comments at a Hispanic conference in San Antonio, Texas.Her press secretary, Michael LaRosa, tweeted the First Lady‚Äôs apology for her on Tuesday. The apology came a day after she made the comparison in her speech at the 2022 UnidosUS Annual Conference while talking about UnidosUS President Raul Yzaguirre‚Äôs work in the organization.‚ÄúRaul helped build this organization with the understanding that the diversity of this community, as distinct as the bodegas of the Bronx, as beautiful as the blossoms of Miami and as unique as the breakfast tacos here in San Antonio, is your strength,‚Äù Mrs. Biden said.The First Lady apologizes that her words conveyed anything but pure admiration and love for the Latino community.‚Äî Michael LaRosa (@MichaelLaRosa46) July 12, 2022The senator asserted this is why Southern Texas will vote Republican this year despite being a traditionally blue area. Cruz said Democrats are losing support among Latinos due to their misguided and ‚Äúwoke‚Äù identity politics.
image_caption: Sen. Ted Cruz, R-Texas, speaks during a news conference with Republican lawmakers about Ukraine, on Capitol Hill, Wednesday, March 2, 2022, in Washington. (AP Photo/Evan Vucci)

story_headline: Gov. Newsom touts Calif. education, bashes Fla. parental rights bill
story_copy: Gov. Newsom touts Calif. education, bashes Fla. parental rights billSen. Chris Murphy, D-Conn., left, who has led in the recent bipartisan Senate talks to rein in gun violence, walks with California Gov. Gavin Newsom at the Capitol in Washington, Thursday, July 14, 2022. (AP Photo/J. Scott Applewhite)OAN NEWSROOMUPDATED 11:28 AM PT ‚Äì Thursday, July 14, 2022Just as President Joe Biden left his poor poll numbers at home for the Middle East, California Governor Gavin Newsom made a visit to the White House. On Wednesday, the Democrat took the stage in Washington, D.C. to accept the 2022 Frank Newman Award for State Innovation, which was awarded to the Golden State for its financial investments to ensure education equity.#ICYMI:¬†@CAgovernor @GavinNewsom today accepting the Frank Newman Award for State Innovation in DC said: ‚ÄúWe believe in debt free college‚Ä¶ We created something called College Corps.‚Äù pic.twitter.com/mYpUz6iEd0‚Äî California Volunteers (@CalVolunteers) July 13, 2022The award‚Äôs name did not include the word excellence as California ranked 44th in math scores and 38th in reading test scores nationally in 2019, while boasting the worst student-to-teacher ratio in the country. Furthermore, California kept public school students out of the classroom more than any other state during its COVID lockdowns as Newsom‚Äôs children were able to attend in-person learning at a private institution.However, Newsom shifted the crowd‚Äôs attention to red states by accusing Florida of censorship for its Parental Rights in Education Act. The Democrat berated the legislation, which gives Florida parents oversight over their children‚Äôs curriculum, and specifically took aim at Florida Governor Ron DeSantis‚Äô press secretary for calling it an ‚Äúanti-grooming bill.‚ÄùMany have speculated that Newsom has recently begun lobbing criticisms at DeSantis because he sees him as a potential rival in the 2024 presidential election. However, when pressed on his intentions outside the White House, Newsom vehemently denied he has any ambitions for the Oval Office. This comes despite Newsom financing ads in Florida attacking the policies of Governor DeSantis.Although the Democrat has professed his dedication to education equity, Florida students did not witness the same widening gap between white and non-white students that California has seen since its draconian COVID lockdowns.
image_caption: Sen. Chris Murphy, D-Conn., left, who has led in the recent bipartisan Senate talks to rein in gun violence, walks with California Gov. Gavin Newsom at the Capitol in Washington, Thursday, July 14, 2022. (AP Photo/J. Scott Applewhite)

story_headline: Senate GOP offers solutions to ‚Äòcrisis turned catastrophe‚Äô
story_copy: Senate GOP offers solutions to ‚Äòcrisis turned catastrophe‚ÄôU.S. Sen. James Risch (R-ID) attends a Senate Foreign Relations Committee hearing on U.S. policy towards Belarus at the Dirksen Senate Office Building on June 09, 2021 in Washington, DC.¬† (Photo by Kevin Dietsch/Getty Images)OAN NEWSROOMUPDATED 6:22 AM PT ‚Äì Thursday, July 14, 2022The GOP is expressing its commitment to finding real solutions for the southern border crisis that continues to unravel under the Biden administration. On Wednesday, several Republican senators held a press conference to announce how they plan to end the crisis.Ranking member of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, Sen. James Risch (R-Idaho) and Sen. Rob Portman (R-Ohio) introduced a new bill called the Solving Border Crisis Act. Risch said although it‚Äôs unlikely the current administration will change course, this bill could serve as a ‚Äúblueprint‚Äù for the next administration.‚ÄúI can‚Äôt stress enough the importance of implementing these solutions immediately to protect our sovereignty and national security,‚Äù stated the Idaho lawmaker. ‚ÄúWe will be pressing hard to move this legislation, but we are not na√Øve. We are here because the administration wants to have the situation the way it is because they could fix it and the could fix it easily. This isn‚Äôt going to change unless the administration reverses course and they probably won‚Äôt.‚ÄùThe Biden administration‚Äôs dismantling of the effective immigration system it inherited has created a full-blown disaster at the southern border.That's why @senrobportman & I have introduced the Solving the Border Crisis Act to prevent this disaster from getting any worse. pic.twitter.com/Hao8GVNykd‚Äî Jim Risch (@SenatorRisch) July 13, 2022He also noted that the current administration has dismantled the work of 45th President Donald Trump who worked hard to secure the US border. However, as Sen. John Barrasso (R-Wyo.) pointed out, this is not only a border crisis, but a drug smuggling crisis as well. He said it‚Äôs no longer just border states being affected while citing an increase in the number of deaths and overdoses from fentanyl all across the US.‚ÄúThe Democrats and Joe Biden have turned American into one big sanctuary city and have turned every state into a border state,‚Äù Barrasso stated. ‚ÄúIn my home state of Wyoming, we‚Äôve seen triple the number of deaths from fentanyl in the last two years.‚ÄùSen. Ted Cruz (R-Texas) even predicted South Texas will become red due to the Biden administration‚Äôs negligence to the southern border.‚ÄúI am predicting right now in November we will see South Texas, which has been electing Democrats for over 100 years, South Texas is going to elect at least two and maybe three new Republican members of Congress,‚Äù he asserted. ‚ÄúAll of whom are Hispanic woman, all of whom are are seeing the crime, disease and suffering and misery caused by Joe Biden‚Äôs open borders.‚ÄùThis comes as 2.6 million migrants have crossed the border illegally since Biden took office. This figure doesn‚Äôt include those who avoided apprehension by border security.
image_caption: U.S. Sen. James Risch (R-ID) attends a Senate Foreign Relations Committee hearing on U.S. policy towards Belarus at the Dirksen Senate Office Building on June 09, 2021 in Washington, DC.¬† (Photo by Kevin Dietsch/Getty Images)
